title: 'Sound Thinking' Americana-like Serif
content:
Hi Folks,  
This serif has baffled me. It reminds me of [Americana](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/americana/), but the x-height is quite different. The ’T’, ’k’ and ’g’ seem pretty distinctive, and do not match Americana.

Anyone recognize this?

Thanks,  
- Mike

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [SoundThinking.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161142/http:/typophile.com/files/SoundThinking.jpg) | 37.18 KB |

 [‹ (x) Voodoo Doll logo - Vantasyhouse {Angel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33633 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Courier-like sans in Tate Etc. magazine - Everson Mono {Angel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161142/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33609 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bowfinpw

comments.content: The g reminds me a bit of fligh high bold... But the serif style isnt the same:/

I haven’t heard of that font. Do you have a link to show it?

For some reason I think I have seen this as a display font, from a small foundry, or maybe a freebie font, but I have not found it in Larabie’s stuff or Nick Curtis’s freebies.

Any other ideas?

- Mike Yanega
It reminded me of Broadsheet by Luke Owens, but that only comes close.

’Broadsheet’ is just Owens’ take on ’Americana’, so that doesn’t get us much closer.

I think ’Fligh High’ was actually Ingrimayne’s [’Fly High’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/fly-high/), right? That’s not too far off, but as you said Paul-Kenji, the serifs aren’t quite right.

The way the letters disconnect suggests adding negative stroke to the letters to erode them, but I still can’t place the font. I thought [’Carlton’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161142/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/carlton/) had some similarities, especially in x-height, but I don’t think that’s it either.

Any more ideas?

- Mike Yanega

I just looked back at the sample, and I don’t know what I was imagining when I said Carlton was like it. Never mind that one. Maybe Carlton flattened would be similar, but nah.

- Mike Yanega
